snippet: Eager to reach the growing number of younger fans without televisions, the N.F.L. will broadcast 10 Thursday night regular-season games over the Internet.
abstract: NFL announces $15 million deal with Twitter to stream network broadcasts of 10 Thursday night games in 2016; league is looking for ways to reach new young fans, while flagging social network hopes partnership can help reverse its declining numbers.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and MIKE ISAAC

lead_paragraph: Eager to reach the growing number of younger fans without televisions, the N.F.L. will broadcast 10 Thursday night regular-season games over the Internet.

headline.main: Twitter Gains Rights to Stream Thursday N.F.L. Games
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. to Stream Thursday Games on Twitter Alongside Network Broadcasts
